intro: Rabdosia macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered rabdosia, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, two-lipped flowers that range in color from violet to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Rabdosia macrantha is often used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
